title: Should companies be more open to remote work culture? - Quora

response.answer_text: Absolutely! Here are some of the issues that remote work solves/helps with: Employee engagement: A Gallup poll shows that disengaged employees cost organizations over $550B annually worldwide. Employees who work from home tend to be more engaged, productive, and invested in the success of a company.Lack of talent: Traditional offices require the best employees for the job to be located within commuting distance. With remote and distributed teams, HR now has a worldwide talent pool to choose from.Loyal employees: A number of studies show that workplace flexibility in scheduling and location is the number one reason why employees quit jobs, and why they would be willing to switch.The future of work is definitely here, and employees are choosing to take fully remote positions that allow them to balance the needs of caring for their families and advancing in their careers. To learn more about the office of the future, check out The Death of the Corporate Headquarters May Be in Sight - This is What it Looks Like Hope this helps.
